logicalComponents
Class Hand

java.lang.Object
  logicalComponents.Hand

public class Hand
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains a collection of Joints which combined form a representation of the human hand. It contains a key-value data set in which the key is an instance from the JointName and the value is an instance from Joint.

This class also utilizes a custom-built event propagation system which sends update notifications to all classes registered to it. In order for a class to receive events based on this class, it must implement the HandChangeListener interface, and then be added via the Hand.addHandChangeListener() method.

As a result of containing the Joint class, many of the methods from that class are overridden. To get a more detailed description of some of the methods, go to Joint.

Author:
DMac

Hand

public Hand(int min,
            int max)
Creates a new Hand instance, with the initial min and max positions for each Joint set to 'min' and 'max', respectively.

Parameters:
min - the minimum position of all joints in the Hand
max - the maximum position of all joints in the Hand

getPosition

public double getPosition(JointName location)
Returns the position value of the Joint at the given location

Parameters:
location - The joint whose position is being set
Returns:
A double value between 1 and 0, where 1 is completely flexed and 0 is completely straightened

getMax

public int getMax(JointName location)
Returns the maximum position of the Joint at the given JointName

Parameters:
location - The joint whose position is being set
Returns:
The maximum value this Joint can have.

addHandChangeListener

public void addHandChangeListener(HandChangeListener hcl)

Parameters:
